EMPHATIC STRESS

Emphatic stress is a test used to examine a candidate’s ability to identify a particular word in a sentence that needs to be emphasised or pronounced with more force, energy or loudness.

In a sentence, when a particular word is UNDERLINED or all the letters of a word are CAPITALISED, then the aim is to draw attention.

So, in clear terms, EMPHATIC STRESS is a phonetic exercise that is made up of a statement and a set of questions, the candidate is expected to select an option from the set of questions that will be suitable to the statement that contains the EMPHASIZED word. Always Choose a sentence that does not contain the emphatic word but the same sentence structure, and will make the speaker of the first sentence stress the emphatic word in capital letters.

 

For example:

THEIR children speak better French than English.

The emphasized word is –THEIR…

The statement is most times an answer to a question. Now, which of the question is appropriate to the statement?

(a) Do their husbands speak better French than English?

(b) What language do their children speak better than English?

(c) Do their children speak better French than English?

(d) Whose children speak better French than English?

 

The answer is option D…Option D is the appropriate question that matches the statement. So it is:

Whose children speak better French than English?

THEIR children speak better French than English.

 

Tips:

(1) Find an option that does not contain the emphasised word. For example, option D above does not have the emphasised word…THEIR

 

(2) Let the option be a suitable question that will reflect the emphasis on the emphasised word.

So, the interrogative pronoun…WHOSE…matches with the emphasised word…THEIR!

 

(3) Sometimes, the emphasised word will not appear in any of the option, then in this case, select an option that will express an opposite of what the statement is:

Packool BOUGHT a new car.

(a) Did Timi hire a new car

(b) Does Timi deal in cars?

(c) Has Timi acquired a new car?

(d) Does Timi have a new car?

Now, none of the options have the emphasised word ---BOUGHT…so what will the answer be?

The answer should be opposite in meaning to the statement.

Option B bears DEAL

Option C bears ACQUIRED

Option D bears HAVE

These options have similar meaning and are related to BOUGHT…only option A used…HIRE…so option A is the correct answer.

 

UNN PUTME Example

In each of the questions below, the word in capital letters has the emphatic stress. Choose the option that best fits the expression in the sentence.

 

1. The telephone line has been RESTORED.

A. Has the electric light been restored? B. Has the electric light been cut off?

C. What happened to the electric line? D. Has the telephone line been cut off?

(D. Has the telephone line been cut off? 2012/2013 no 14 [DIRECT ENTRY])

 

2. My elder brother was appointed minister of FINANCE.

A. Was your younger brother appointed Minister of Finance?

B. Was your elder brother appointed Minister of Finance?

C. Was your elder brother appointed Commissioner of Finance?

D. Was your elder brother appointed Minister of Works?

 

(D. Was your elder brother appointed Minister of Works? (2012/2013 no 14 [DIRECT ENTRY]).

 

3. The secretary enjoys travelling AT NIGHT.

A. Did the secretary enjoy travelling by day. B. Does the secretary enjoy travelling by day

C. Who enjoys travelling by night. D. Does the secretary hate travelling at night

(B. Does the secretary enjoy travelling by day (2005/06 ANSWERS Session [II] no 15)

(Choose the answer the phrase that will make the speaker to repeat the particular phrase, meaning that the phrase should not be there. The emphatic phrase is “at night”. Options “C” and “D” contain the emphatic phrase, so they are eliminated. “A” and “B” are the likely answers, because they do not have the emphatic phrase. However, “A” is not)

 

4. My brother bought EXACTLY twenty cups of rice.

A. Who bought exactly twenty cups of beans? B. Did your mother sell exactly twenty cups of rice?

C. Did your mother buy nearly twenty cups of rice? D. Did your sister buy exactly twenty cups of rice?

(C. Did your mother buy nearly twenty cups of rice? (2011/2012, no 12). (Choose the answer, the phrase that will make the speaker to repeat the particular phrase, meaning that the phrase should not be there) 

 

I hope you can see how sweet and easy this emphatic stress is. I guess it is added so that student will not get zero, LOL.

 

JAMB Examples

In each of question below, the word in capital letters has the emphatic. Choose the option to which the given sentence relates

1. Uche LOVES Toyota cars
(a) who loves Toyota cars? (b) What brand of car does Uche love? (c) Does Uche hate Toyota cars? (d) Dose Uche love bicycles?
(Does Uche hate Toyota cars?)


2. The POLICE arrested the suspect
(a) Did the police placate the suspect? (b) Who arrested the suspect? (c) Who did the police arrest? (d) Did the police arrest the suspect?
(Who arrested the suspect?)


3. Maiduguri is the CAPITAL of Borno state
(a) Is Maiduguri the capital of plateau state? (b) Which state is Maiduguri the capital of? (c) Is Maiduguri a town in Borno state? (d) What is the capital of Borno state?
(Is Maiduguri a town in Borno state?)

 

4. EMEKA finished his home work yesterday
A. Was Emeka helped to do his homework? B. Did Emeka do his homework? C. When did Emeka finish his homework? D. Who finished his home work yesterday?
(Who finished his home work yesterday?)


5. Taiwo SAILED to London.
A. Did Taiwo fly to London? B. Did Taiwo sail to Brazil? C. Did Taiwo sail to London? D. Where did Taiwo sail to?
(Did Taiwo fly to London?)


6. My bag is made of LEATHER.
A. Whose bag is made of leather? B. Is my bag made of polythene? C. Is Abu’s bag made of leather? D. Is my bag made of leather?
(Is my bag made of polythene?)
